p: (3) Ferric Reducing Antioxidant Potential (FRAP). The working reagent was prepared by mixing acetate buffer (25 mL, 30 mM, pH 3.6), TPTZ (2.5 mL, 10 mM), and iron chloride (2.5 mL, mM) and incubated at 37°C (15 minutes). Concentrations between 50 mg/L and 500 mg/L of ascorbic acid produced a calibration curve [ 26]. The absorbance was measured at 593 nm for each specimen consisting of working reagent (2.85 mL), test compounds (150 μL, 0.1 mg/mL) diluted in methanol, methanol (150 μL), or stallion.
